result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mary A Rhodes

defendant.name: Rhodes, Mary A
defendant.address: 5115 W National Ave, Apt. 1, Milwaukee, WI 53214

records.addlTxt: Email correspondence with parties. Case scheduled for Return on Warrant on 11/07/2022 at 10:00 am, Br 16.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 10.14.22

11:13 AM Defendant Mary A Rhodes not in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Mary A Rhodes.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue. No action taken on bail. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

ADDRESS INFO for Mary A Rhodes
Current: 5115 W National Ave, Apt. 1, Milwaukee, WI 53214 United States  (Effective: 09-30-2022)
Prior: 4468 North 84th Street #2, Milwaukee, WI 53225

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Mary A Rhodes appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Mary A Rhodes. Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Mary A Rhodes not in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/26/22@2:30pm
